messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] unschooling blogs
messages.msgSnippet: Nah not really a morning person  its more im a crop pot person so alot of times I will through my dry ingredients together late the night before then add the
messages.messageBody:
Nah not really a morning person its more im a crop pot person so alot of
times I will through my dry ingredients together late the night before then add
the liquid and meat in the am and plug in!

*************

Hum sounds like a plan to me. I end up cooking tea with kids in a mood cos they are tired and other stuff to do at the same time. I ought to try it.

Ruth

messages.subject: Re: unschooling blogs
messages.msgSnippet: Though not explicitly an unschooling blog , my favorite is Relaxed Homeskool, which is pretty much what it sounds like: http://bradley.chicago.il.us/kim/
messages.messageBody:
Though not explicitly an "unschooling blog", my favorite is Relaxed
Homeskool, which is pretty much what it sounds like:

http://bradley.chicago.il.us/kim/



Conan.






> Date: Mon, 29 Aug 2005 18:21:35 +0100
> From: "Ruth G" <grayfamily9@...>
> Subject: Unschooling blogs
>
> I read one blog of someone on this list but wonder if any of the
> rest of you do or know unschooling blog links? I like to see how
> unschoolers do things and I am a bit fed up of the "we are starting
> our school schedule next week (or this week a week early)" type
> blogs I seem to be coming across. Also the stuff these people say
> they do ( do people really get up at 5 am everyday even if they
> don't live on a farm?) would give me burn out in a month lol so I
> don't want to read them anymore.
>
> Ruth who is slightly worried she is lazy
>
>

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] unschooling blogs
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Jessica Thanks for this. I have read some very scary stuff lately about moms cooking the evening meal at the crack of dawn so the can school all day!!!!!!
messages.messageBody:
Hi Jessica

Thanks for this. I have read some very scary stuff lately about moms cooking the evening meal at the crack of dawn so the can school all day!!!!!! Also schooling extra days so they can school if they have wasted a day on a trip out!!!!!!! I suppose it helped me clarify it was definitely not for us and unschooling is.
Ruth


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: unschooling blogs
messages.msgSnippet: Here are a few I know of.... http://learninfreedom.blogspot.com The next one is not a blog but c mon, the title cries out for a visit!
messages.messageBody:
Here are a few I know of....
http://learninfreedom.blogspot.com

The next one is not a blog but c'mon, the title cries out for a visit!

http://www.livingjoyfully.ca/

http://journals.aol.com/granron5557/TheColemanHomeschoolingAcademy/

http://millenniumhippies.blogspot.com/

http://radicalchristianunschool.homestead.com/index.html

http://www.danielleconger.com/Homeschool/Welcomehome.html - great
links here!

I recently read a blog about timers going off all day in a
homeschooling house. Reading 1/2 hour. DING! Math hour. DING!

My kids would go crazy!!! and so would I!!!

Read on. Unschooling is loose and joyful and so fun it hardly seems
like work.

Peace~Jessica
